{"step_by_step_thinking": "The staging of nasopharyngeal carcinoma is based on the TNM system. This patient's tumor is located in the nasopharynx with minimal extension into the sphenoid sinus, but no lateral extension. According to the TNM system, this would be classified as T2, N0, M0. T2 indicates a tumor that has extended to the soft tissues of the nasopharynx and/or the sphenoid sinus. N0 indicates no regional lymph node metastasis, and M0 indicates no distant metastasis. According to the AJCC Cancer Staging Manual, a T2, N0, M0 nasopharyngeal carcinoma is classified as stage IIA.", "answer_choice": "C. IIA"}
